page.title: 18Staffing in a Village School
page.content: 32 years ago in Bilbrough School there were 34 pupils, 2 full time teachers, and a cleaner,who doubled as a maid/ dining assistant.Approx. 26 children stayed school dinner,which was brought in cans from Bishopthorpe.Free school milk and cod liver oil capsules were provided.In 1985 there are 30 pupils, 2 full time teachers,and the part_time assistance of a third teacher,a cook, a dining assistant,a clerk and a cleaner.12 children stay school dinner regularly,15 bring packed lunches and 3 go home.About 20 meals are prepared for Askham Richard School. In 1953 there were outside toilets (earth closets) in the playground. The heating was by coke stoves.These were lit by the cleaner and stoked by the teachers.Fuel was in short supply.Now there is indoor sanitation,hot water, a playing field and electrical heating
